Okay, let me get this started. HECK YEAH, I recommend this game.
Background time. I was not a gamer myself. The only games I played before this were either online or on my phone. Until a friend of mine gave me Portal for my birthday. I played it and completed it (with the help of walkthroughs) in less than three days.
Now let me tell you what I love about this game. I love how it puts puzzles realistically and at a first person perspective. the puzzle games I hear of are usually 2D or, when 3D, had so many complicated graphics that I don't know what to do. Portal, however, keeps it simple and allows you to clearly think.
Not to mention, the graphics. Oh my goodness, I could go on about it. Now I'm not much of an expert on gaming history myself, but I've heard that these were pretty good for 2007. I think I may be biased because it's my first video game, but it's still so good.
The gameplay is super simple and fun. I was a bit intimidated by the trailer because my reflexes weren't that good, but I noticed it really improved easily as I played along through the game. This is a good starter game for beginners in gaming because of this. After finishing it, I felt as if I could move onto something more fast-paced, such as a shooter (I was in the middle of Half-Life, but after rage-qutting a month ago, today I decided to get Half-Life 2).
Aesthetically, the mood of the game is super realistic, as in really setting the mood. As you move through the test chambers, you start to wonder about so many things. It puts you in the game. The soundtrack is not that popular compared to Portal 2, as it's super short and only plays in a parts in the game, but I like it because it's simple and doesn't sound like a soundtrack playing behind you. The music combines a calming techno that goes nowhere with what you think mysterious rooms you're testing in would sound like.
The only cons of the game is that it's pretty hard (and rage quitty to some) if you're like me (super stupid :/). However, it's a pretty short game and for a beginner gamer, it's a good length. Even if it's hard, just keep on trying till you run out of cake!
I still can't believe this game is ten years old. Just play it. I'm telling you.

Eines der besten Spiele auf der Welt. Kompromisslos, Genial, Herzzerreißend.  Hier wird sowohl das Hirn als auch das Herz angesprochen. Ein Muss für jeden echten Gamer, den, der es Mal werden will und Freizeit-Zocker. Absolute Speilempfehlung für Jedermann.

When Portal came out it was the best thing since...well ever. With it's dark humor, and chalenging puzzles it needed nothing more. The story isn't to deep that you get overloaded with usless back story. The game play was so inovative that it created an entire sub culture. This game will actually increase your deductive reasoning and problem solving skills. You can rest easy and  let your children play this game knowing they will be "smarter" having played this game.

Уникальная во всех смыслах игра!!!

A must-play game that looks very nice, yet still runs well on low-spec systems. It also fits very creatively into the Half-Life universe. A first person shooter that involves no shooting, and still manages to be incredibly fun. A puzzle game with the perfect balance of simplicity and challenge. A true masterpiece of level design, complimented by superb dialogue reminiscent of 2001: A Space Odyssey. 
A certified Valve classic, and priced to sell when on sale. Pick it up with Portal 2 and have the time of your life.
This game is still one of my favorites
恕我直言，这种游戏，我只能给满分
There is absolutely nothing I can say that hasn't been said before, Portal is a masterpiece and it should be absolutely played by everyone and anyone.

Portal is by far the best puzzle game I have ever played. I'd always heard about Portal and only just got around to playing it. This game is fantastic. The difficulty progression is nice and gradual, and the addition of the challenge versions of levels provides extra fun after the main storyline is complete. I quite enjoy the humor, and I can see where ideas for games like,  "The Stanley Parable" came from. Overall Portal is a well-balanced, short game to play. 

The only thing I can see being upsetting to some is that the game (although fun to return to for nostalgia) has an end point that can be reached rather quickly, but for this price it's a great length and quality.
Очень интересная игра очень советую

This, like Half-Life, is a must-play for PC gamers. I decided to give it a try one day, hearing the praise of past players (I was quite late to play it). My experience was incredible and truly memorable. It has great voice acting (meaning GLADOS) with a chilling atmosphere and ambiance. It combines a first-person shooter with a mind-racking puzzle game. Also, this is just one of those "satisfying" games. When you finally crack a puzzle or fly through the visually pleasing portals, you are fully content. No other game can compare...except Portal 2 of course.

Awesome game! I'm surprised nobody thought of the concept before. Really addicting puzzle game that is a perfect level of difficulty - not so hard that it's frustrating, but not so easy that you don't feel proud of yourself. I'm not usually one for puzzle games so this review should mean something. :P

Maybe even your favorite. This game is choc full of puzzles, humor, and a splash of violence and mystery. Everything you love. It's clever, playful, creative, different. Different in the way that it is actually good. Good from the first second. And if you're still reading this, you've contemplated your purchase for too long. Here, Let me help you. Buy it!
